result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Jamie J Serio in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case dismissed and read into 15ct318.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on September 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jamie J Serio in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is working on obtaining valid license.  Defendant still needs to pay fines and costs.  Court will set the 15CM562 matter for trial.  All other matters to follow along for further scheduling.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Judicial transfer done pursuant to Chief Judge Order 11-SO-03(67) effective May 1, 2011 related to the assignment of new cases to the judge responsible for any cases currently pending for a defendant.  Cases 'currently' pending include post-judgment matters awaiting sentencing after revocation, modification of sentence, or any other action by a judge.

Defendant Jamie J Serio in court with Attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek requests an adjournment so Defendant can work on obtaining his driver's license.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed comply with all license restrictions.   Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Jamie J Serio in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
